thread.title: Blasters in Discussions to Restructure Stadium Lease
thread.title_full: Blasters in Discussions to Restructure Stadium Lease - FOX 14 TV Joplin and Pittsburg News Weather Sports |

author: Jacob Lenard
title: Blasters in Discussions to Restructure Stadium Lease
text:
RELEASE FROM THE JOPLIN BLASTERS:
The City of Joplin and the Joplin Blasters have been in discussions to restructure the lease of Joe Becker Stadium.
Council member and Mayor Mike Seibert said, “This has been somewhat of an ongoing conversation throughout the season with it being the first season. We’ve been keeping a pulse on attendance and how that impacts revenues. The conversation had been to get through the season and then assess the year and entertain options that will work for the team and the city. We now have some hard data to work with.”
Joplin Blasters CEO Gabriel Suarez agrees with Seibert and looks forward to a long standing relationship between the city, the citizens, and the Joplin Blasters.
The Joplin Blasters start their 2nd season in the South division of the American Association of Professional Baseball in May 2016. They will play 50 of their 100 games at Joe Becker Stadium. The Blasters off-season office hours are Monday – Thursday from 11 a.m. – 4 p.m. and are located at 131 South High Avenue in Joplin, Missouri.
